abstrac: Dream your idea, We makes it happen.
bio:
Our Vision:
Offshorent was established with the goal of providing small and medium sized businesses a full spectrum of outsourcing services at a lower cost. Our vision is to help small to medium sized businesses custom build their own dedicated team, in a professional, transparent environment – without the hassles and high cost of setting up and managing an offshore center.

Services:
We provide services using various platforms such as
Mobile:- iOS, Android, (Native & Hybrid), HTML5. 
Prototype: Using Just in Mind, Balsamiq, Invision App.
E-commerce: - Magento, WooCommerce Shopify, Volusion, Prestashop
CMS: WordPress, Joomla, Drupal
OPEN SOURCE:- PHP (cake PHP, Laravel, Zend, Core PHP), JQuery, Python
Front end: HTML5, CSS3, Angular.js, JQry, Javascript
Creative:-Graphic Design, HTML5, Adobe Suite, 2D&3D
Microsoft - C#, VB.net, Asp.net, MVC
Database: MSSQL, MySQL

Global Locations:
Offshorent is currently operational in four different countries; United States, Norway, Australia and India. Offshorent’s corporate headquarters is located in King of Prussia, PA with offices in Norway and Australia.

We prefer to work fixed price projects so that you know what you are going to spend before starting the work.
In some cases when the scope of the work is not known, we minimize the risk by rapid prototyping to define the actual requirments.
When we do take on hourly work, we give you direct access to our real time reporting tools so that you can access our time sheets directly.
We always work on milestone based payments.
Hours of operation: 8.00 am to 8.00 pm (EST)
(Emergency support available outside the normal working hours.)

Fixed Cost Project Payment Terms 
Payment Terms: 30% upfront, 50% on staging and 20% prior to production release.
Payment Method: Check, PayPal, Credit Card, Wire.

Hourly Costs: $30 to $75

abstrac: Bringing excitement and marketability to the ordinary and unknown things in life.
bio:
As a co-founder of a technology company, I was responsible for its growth from zero revenue into a respected multi-million dollar business until its recent acquisition by a large publicly traded company. Although my responsibilities were of an executive nature, I was heavily involved with the sales and marketing aspect of the business, including the creation of various types of literature, such as brochures, press releases, legal documents, manuals, content marketing for web sites, testimonials, white papers and case studies.
My responsibilities also required that I traveled extensively around the World and have written two books about my experiences in foreign countries from a business and tourist perspective. I have had articles published on web-based travel magazines, and spoken at trade shows and technology events.
My experience is centered on technology and anything travel related, but have also created sales pitches for other industries.

I have no fixed hours of operation, but rather a philosophy of doing whatever it takes to get the job done in a timely manner, usually by the customer’s requested date.
Quotes can be provided after enough information has been gathered to analyze the project. A Non-Disclosure Agreement can be signed if desired to protect confidentiality.
Payment terms – 50% up front and 50% upon completed. Expenses for travel is extra but can be part of the quote if known up front.
Communication preference is via email, or if a conference call is required, then phone communication is a must. If any party is out of the country, then the use of Skype, Viber, etc. can be used. File transfers can be used by the normal methods of email attachments, FTP, DropBox, etc.

self-starter with extensive background in both server and client
based Internet application development, seeks computer programming

Very flexible with terms. Can work W2, 1099, or Corp-to-Corp. Prefer Corp-to-Corp.

Typical Project Payment requirements
25% down to begin work
25% upon completion of design, wireframes and mock-ups
25% upon completion of site and commencement of QA / beta testing
25% upon site launch.

Hourly rates are billed time and materials on a bi-weekly basis. Prefer Net30 terms. Discounts available for pre-paid hours.

Actual payment structures depend on project requirements and may vary.
